business.headline: Bitcoin hovers around $71,000, hits weakest level in about 15 monthsBitcoin fell nearly 2% to around $71,000 on February 5, marking its weakest level in about 15 months. The world's largest cryptocurrency has now lost more than 42% from its October peak of $126,000 last year.

World Govt Summit 2026: Ignoring international law risks return to 'law of the jungle' President of Timor-Leste José Ramos-Horta said the world is witnessing the steady breakdown of global systems that were created to protect peace, human rights, and fair international trade.

India, Gulf Cooperation Council agree to restart talks on long-pending free trade dealThe move formally revives negotiations between India and the six-nation bloc after a long gap and signals a renewed push to deepen economic cooperation.
Sensex ends 504 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; Eternal down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 503.76 points to close at 83,313.93, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 133.20 points to end at 25,642.80.

Sensex down 500 points: Why is stock market falling today?At 2:30 PM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 569.43 points at 83,248.26. The NSE Nifty50 also declined, falling 164.50 points to 25,611.50. Both benchmark indices were down by over half a percent, showing clear pressure across the market.

AI and policy are redefining digital lifestyles, say global tech leadersAl Shamsi said telecom companies are no longer just service providers focused on speed and coverage. They are evolving into broader technology platforms that support consumer, enterprise and government services.

A system upgrade led to a criminal tax notice. How Budget 2026 changes thatA routine system upgrade or staff reshuffle should not land a business in criminal trouble. Yet, under earlier tax rules, even genuine operational delays could trigger prosecution. Budget 2026 aims to fix this by easing penalties for procedural lapses.

Competition watchdog orders probe into IndiGo after mass flight cancellationsIn a 16-page order, the Competition Commission of India (CCI) said that IndiGo, which holds a dominant position in the domestic aviation market, may have abused its strength by cancelling a large number of flights.

Silver ETFs sink up to 15%, gold ETFs remain relatively steadySilver ETFs witnessed aggressive one-day selling, with losses ranging from over 10% to nearly 15% during morning trade. The fall was much steeper than what was seen in gold ETFs.

A slow reset, not a shock: What the EU-India FTA means for liquor companiesThe EU-India FTA is not an immediate disruption to India's domestic alcohol industry but a calibrated strategic shift that will gradually reshape competition, pushing domestic producers to evolve through premiumisation, enforcement-backed regulation, and long-term adaptability rather than relying on tariff protection.

Sensex falls 400 points: Are IT stocks down today, do investors need to panic?At around 10 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 448.57 points at 83,369.12. The NSE Nifty50 also slipped, falling 144.95 points to 25,631.05. The fall was close to half a percent, showing a clear pause after the recent rally.

Sensex, Nifty open lower amid IT stock worries; metal shares major laggardsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 225.69 points to 83,592.00, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 87.65 points to 25,688.35 as of 9:23 am.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will IT shares fall again on stock markets?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,820 points at around 7:54 am. This suggests that the Nifty 50 may open above Wednesday's closing level of 25,776.

We want to double our stores in India in next 2-3 years: Hugo Boss CEOIn an exclusive conversation with India Today, Hugo Boss CEO Daniel Grieder discusses the company's strategic focus on the Indian market.

Arvind Panagariya on why India's trade deals with US, EU could be bigger moment than 1991In an exclusive interview with India Today, Dr. Arvind Panagariya, Chairman of the 16th Finance Commission and former Vice-Chairman of NITI Aayog, shares his thoughts on the landmark India-US trade deal and more.

From policies to AI: How businesses and governments can deliver at scaleMohit Joshi and Kaan Terzioglu discussed the importance of long-term thinking, ethical practices, and digital solutions in building credibility with customers, governments, and societies.

Elon Musk becomes world's first person with $800 billion after SpaceX-xAI dealMusk is now $578 billion richer than Google co-founder Larry Page, the world's second-wealthiest person, who is estimated to be worth $281 billion.

Gold jumps nearly 4%, silver up 6%: Is the rally set to continue?At the time of writing, gold was priced at Rs 1,58,858, up 3.28% or Rs 5,049. Silver showed an even stronger recovery, trading at Rs 2,83,395, higher by 5.74% or Rs 15,380.

Sensex, Nifty end higher amid volatile trade; Infosys falls over 7%The S&P BSE Sensex closed 78.56 points higher at 83,817.69, while the NSE Nifty50 added 48.45 points to settle at 25,776. Most broader market indices also finished positive, even as intraday volatility spiked.

Infosys, TCS shares tumble amid global tech sell-off: Is the AI fear justified?Was today's slide in IT stocks a glimpse of the future or just market overreaction? For investors, the only question now is whether the AI threat is real or simply rattling nerves.

entertainment.headline: BLACKPINK'S Jisoo and Seo In-guk's Boyfriend on Demand release date out Netflix announced the premiere date for Boyfriend on Demand, starring Jisoo of BLACKPINK and Seo In-guk. The series explores modern romance through a virtual dating subscription.

Desi Bling: Netflix's Dubai Bling spin-off draws mixed reactions online Netflix is launching Desi Bling, a luxury reality show showcasing the lavish lives of wealthy Indians in Dubai, but it has sparked mixed reactions online. While the show promises glamour and drama, many viewers have criticised its authenticity and casting choices, leading to a lively debate on social media.

Richa Chadha reacts sharply to Indian-origin author Deepak Chopra's Epstein files link Richa Chadha commented on Deepak Chopra's apology after his name emerged in the new Epstein Files. The actor also referred to the other Deepak, who is going viral for confronting a mob, protecting a Muslim shopkeeper's store.

Coolie not in Top 10 Rajinikanth films list for daughter Soundarya. Here's why Soundarya Rajinikanth, daughter of actor Rajinikanth and producer of the upcoming Tamil film With Love, gave her honest opinion on the 2025 film Coolie, during a recent interview. She spoke about not being throughly impressed by it.

Suniel Shetty questions films on Akbar, Babur: History should be about our culture Suniel Shetty questioned films focussing on Akbar and Babur instead of Shivaji Maharaj and Rajput kings. He emphasised that history should be about our culture.

The 50 Day 4 highlights: Maxtern threatens to slap Elvish, faces consequences YouTuber Maxtern threatened to slap Elvish Yadav on The 50, reigniting their long-running feud with explosive allegations. The tension turned physical when Elvish's friends confronted Maxtern and pushed him to the ground inside the house.

Relationship Goals review: A not-so-subtle sales pitch garbed as rom-comRelease Date:Wed Feb 04, 2026 Relationship Goals movie review: Prime Video's Relationship Goals mixes romance with overt self-help promotion. The film struggles to deliver genuine emotional impact amid heavy product placement, says our review.

Govinda had gun, acted in self-defence at 3 am: Manager recounts attack attempt Govinda's manager denied rumours linking the actor to any criminal or violent incident, saying he acted purely in self-defence. He revealed that the incident occurred late at night and involved unidentified individuals near the actor's residence.

Actor Silambarasan stands by Vijay as Jana Nayagan release remains uncertain Actor Silambarasan TR has spoken out in support of Vijay, whose film Jana Nayagan remains delayed due to ongoing legal hurdles with the Cental Board of Film Certification (CBFC).

Adarsh Gourav on Arijit Singh's playback exit: I'm sure he has his reasons Actor Adarsh Gourav opened up about his admiration for singer Arijit Singh. In an interview with India Today, Gourav praised Arijit's decision to live life on his own terms.

Ram Charan and Upasana take their twins home from hospital. Video out Ram Charan and Upasana have brought their newborn twins home from a Hyderabad hospital. The family is set to celebrate the arrival, while Ram Charan's new film release faces a delay.

AR Rahman clarifies his communal bias remark after backlash: Better we move on After AR Rahman's comments on the industry's "communal" nature sparked outrage, the composer has addressed the backlash. Reflecting on his clarification, Rahman insisted on moving forward, stating that those who know him do not require any further explanation.

Exclusive: Vvan BTS pic teases Tamannaah Bhatia, Sidharth Malhotra's fresh chemistry IndiaToday.in exclusively accessed a BTS image of Tamannaah Bhatia and Sidharth Malhotra from Vvan, teasing their first on-screen collaboration.

The Investigation of Lucy Letby review: This chilling case offers no closureRelease Date:Thu Feb 05, 2026 Netflix's documentary revisits the conviction of neonatal nurse Lucy Letby for infant murders. It highlights hospital system failures and the complexities behind the case.

Telugu actor Eesha Rebba files complaint over obscene Instagram comments Actor Eesha Rebba filed a complaint at the Banjara Hills Police Station to report harassment after receiving obscene and abusive comments on Instagram amid promotional activities for her recent Telugu film.

No royalties, low pay, fear culture: Abhijeet Sawant on playback singing struggles Abhijeet Sawant, winner of Indian Idol Season 1, has addressed ongoing issues in the film music industry regarding singer pay and royalties. His comments come in the wake of Arijit Singh's recent announcement to step away from playback singing.

Anil Kapoor apologises to fan, re-shares Pukar post after forgetting to tag singers Anil Kapoor apologised after forgetting to tag singers in his Pukar anniversary post. His quick response and humility earned praise from fans and social media users alike.

Allu Sirish and Nayanika's yacht bash in Dubai sets stage for March wedding Allu Sirish and Nayanika hosted a pre-wedding celebration on a yacht in Dubai, attended by friends and family. Sophie Choudry shared pictures and videos capturing the festivities.

Never praised 'Vishwaguru': Naseeruddin Shah links university snub to political views Naseeruddin Shah said he was disinvited at the last minute from Mumbai University's Jashn-e-Urdu event and later falsely accused of refusing to attend. He linked the issue to his political criticism, citing "the Vishwaguru" he never praised.

general news.headline: Live: PM Modi speaks in Rajya Sabha amid Opposition's 'Let LoP speak' slogansParliament Session Live Updates: The Motion of Thanks on the President's Address was passed in the Lok Sabha on Thursday without Prime Minister Narendra Modi replying to the debate as repeated disruptions triggered by Rahul Gandhi's speech continued to stall proceedings in the Lower House. The Lok Sabha has remained paralysed since Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi referred to an unpublished memoir of former Army chief General Manoj Naravane, drawing sharp objections from Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Home Minister Amit Shah. According to sources, Prime Minister Modi is likely to reply to the Motion of Thanks in the Rajya Sabha today, where discussion has concluded without disruption. The government is planning to get the Motion of Thanks passed in both Houses on the same day, even if the Lok Sabha debate does not resume normally. Sources also said that discussion on the Union Budget is expected to begin in the Lok Sabha today, even as uncertainty hangs over the smooth conduct of business amid the ongoing standoff. Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for the latest updates on the ongoing Budget Session.
Suryakumar Yadav breaks silence on Pakistan boycott threat: We are ready to playT20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav breaks silence on Pakistan boycott threat, confirms flights booked for Colombo

Trump now does to Xi what he did to ModiA familiar pattern is emerging in US President Donald Trump's claims on social media after calls with leaders. Trump posted preemptively on his talks with Chinese President Xi Jinping like he did after a call with Indian PM Narendra Modi. The posts disregarded protocol and facts.

Why Speaker advised PM to skip Lok Sabha speechLok Sabha Speaker Om Birla said he advised PM Narendra Modi not to attend the House amid Opposition-led chaos, calling the MPs' conduct a "black spot" in Parliament's history.

Govinda had gun, acted in self-defence at 3 am: Manager recounts attack attemptGovinda's manager denied rumours linking the actor to any criminal or violent incident, saying he acted purely in self-defence. He revealed that the incident occurred late at night and involved unidentified individuals near the actor's residence.

Can India really stop buying oil from Russia?President Donald Trump claimed that India had vowed to stop buying oil from Russia. In recent years, Russia emerged as one of the key sources of crude for India. Here we analyse if it is feasible for India to end oil imports from Russia.

Shashi Tharoor shreds Washington Post over 'bizarre' move to lay off son IshaanShashi Tharoor slammed The Washington Post's decision to lay off his son Ishaan Tharoor, calling it a 'bizarre' and 'self-immolating' move despite his newsletter having over 500,000 subscribers.

Salaam Cricket Live: Replacing Virat, Rohit not easy, but youngsters have stepped up, says GavaskarSalaam Cricket 2026, T20 World Cup: Sunil Gavaskar has said that replacing players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma isn't easy, but also praised the youngsters for stepping in their shoes. He also praised Suryakumar Yadav and the U19 team for advancing to the finals.

Thank you, Pakistan: Bangladesh reveals big cricket nexus against IndiaBangladesh's sports adviser Asif Nazrul thanked Pakistan for backing Dhaka's boycott of the T20 World Cup, after Islamabad decided to skip its match against India in Colombo. A day earlier, Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif publicly justified the move as standing "completely" with Bangladesh. This exposed how both governments made cricket a theatre of a political engagement against India.

They hated being called Indian: Father's shocking claim in triple suicide caseIn an interview with India Today, Chetan Kumar, the father of the three girls who jumped to death from their Ghaziabad flat, claimed they had begun rejecting their Indian identity and wanted to settle in Korea.

Scared of Epstein files? Priyanka Gandhi jabs PM Modi over Lok Sabha no-showPriyanka Gandhi's remarks came after Union Minister JP Nadda, speaking in the Rajya Sabha, described Rahul Gandhi as "naive." She said the Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha should be allowed to speak freely.

10 labourers killed as blast rocks coal mine in Meghalaya, rescue underwayThe blast occurred inside a coal mine, leading to heavy casualties among labourers present at the site. Authorities suspect that most of the victims were workers from Assam.

Never praised 'Vishwaguru': Naseeruddin Shah links university snub to political viewsNaseeruddin Shah said he was disinvited at the last minute from Mumbai University's Jashn-e-Urdu event and later falsely accused of refusing to attend. He linked the issue to his political criticism, citing "the Vishwaguru" he never praised.

Yunus's rush to ink secretive deal with US has Bangladesh exporters worriedThe interim setup of Muhammad Yunus is set to sign a tariff deal with the US. However, the non-disclosure agreement that keeps details shrouded in mystery has got Bangladeshi business leaders concerned. Then there is a bigger question. Is it legal for the unelected Yunus regime to ink a deal even as an elected government could come to office in weeks time?

Not one Muslim? Indian businessman comes under racial attack at Riyadh exhibitionIn the video, the man appears to mock the firm for its religious identity, sneering that it has "not even one Muslim." The controversy gained traction after a UAE-based political analyst shared the video online, condemning the incident as "blatant racism."

Jewar airport: When farmers became crorepatis overnight, then lost it all on luxuriesFor generations, land was the farmers' only steady asset, producing food, income and security. Compensation replaced that asset with a lump sum, but this money came without financial planning support, guidance or long-term safeguards.

K-dramas, K-pop, kimchi: Why Korean culture won India's heartKorean pop culture has surged in India since 2022, spanning dramas, music, food, fashion, and language learning. From family-centric storytelling to soft masculinity and female-focused narratives, Korean content has struck a deep emotional chord across age groups, becoming one of the most influential global cultural forces shaping Indian audiences today.

Can humans give birth in space? Yes, no, maybeSpace has evolved from an exploration outpost to a routine workplace, while Assisted Reproductive Technologies (ART) like automated IVF and cryopreservation have become advanced and accessible.

What is Anthropic Claude Cowork, tool that hit Infosys, TCS, other SaaS companies?Infosys, TCS and other SaaS companies lost hundreds of billions of dollars in market value just like that. Reason? It was AI.

16 DNA tests later, Mumbai man arrested for raping, impregnating daughterThe case surfaced in October 2025 when doctors at a city-based hospital informed police that the woman brought in with complaints of abdominal pain was five months pregnant.

Woman sends sealed package through Rapido. What the delivery boy found shocked himA woman used Rapido's porter service to send a sealed package. However, what the delivery boy found in the package when he reached the drop location left him confused and shocked.

Poor judgement: Deepak Chopra breaks silence on mention in Epstein filesIndian-American and wellness guru Deepak Chopra has broken silence on his name's mention in the Jeffrey Epstein files, saying he regrets the email exchanges and that those reflected a poor judgement in tone.

India-US statement on trade deal in 4-5 days, agriculture safeguardedThe much-awaited statement is likely to lift the secrecy that has shrouded the trade deal ever since Trump unilaterally announced that a trade deal with India had been reached. There was no mention of the deal in PM Modi's post.

Energy security India's priority, open to Venezuela oil trade: Govt on Trump's claimMinistry of External Affairs (MEA) spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said India is open to exploring Venezuelan crude commercially, stressing energy policy followed market realities and national security. No automatic shift from Russian Iranian oil has been confirmed.

sports.headline: Anurag Thakur gets relief as Supreme Court lifts nine-year BCCI ban The Supreme Court has lifted the nine-year ban on Anurag Thakur, allowing him to participate in BCCI affairs after noting the ban was not meant to be lifelong and citing his unconditional apology.

Uncertainty over India vs Pakistan match not good for players: Ishant Sharma Former India bowler Ishant Sharma has expressed concern for players amid the uncertainty of the India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match. The ongoing boycott threat by Pakistan could impact players' preparations and tournament dynamics.

Be the same person no matter what happens: Rishabh Pant reveals Rahul Dravid's advice Pant, who flourished under Dravid across formats, said one piece of advice from the Indian legend has stayed with him.

"I think the key is not thinking about it too much and not dwelling on it. There's one really good line I learnt from Rahul (Dravid) bhai. He always told me one thing: 'Rishabh, no matter what happens, try to be the same person when you score a hundred and when you score a zero,'" Pant said.

"I think, as an athlete, that's the hardest thing to do — to remain who you are. Emotions sometimes get the better of you, but that line always stays with me. So personally, I try that. Whether I score zero or a hundred, I want to be the same guy. Maybe when I get out, it hurts more. I don't enjoy scoring runs as much as I feel the pain of getting out," the wicketkeeper-batter concluded.
Suryakumar Yadav breaks silence on Pakistan boycott threat: We are ready to play T20 World Cup: Suryakumar Yadav breaks silence on Pakistan boycott threat, confirms flights booked for Colombo

Dravid's student, now Abhishek's fan: Rishabh Pant on batting mavericks Rishabh Pant has revealed his admiration for two batting mavericks - Rahul Dravid and Abhishek Sharma. Speaking on India Today's Salaam Cricket, Pant revealed how one of Dravid's advises will stay with him lifelong.

Salaam Cricket Live: Replacing Virat, Rohit not easy, but youngsters have stepped up, says Gavaskar Salaam Cricket 2026, T20 World Cup: Sunil Gavaskar has said that replacing players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma isn't easy, but also praised the youngsters for stepping in their shoes. He also praised Suryakumar Yadav and the U19 team for advancing to the finals.

Thank you, Pakistan: Bangladesh reveals big cricket nexus against India Bangladesh's sports adviser Asif Nazrul thanked Pakistan for backing Dhaka's boycott of the T20 World Cup, after Islamabad decided to skip its match against India in Colombo. A day earlier, Pakistani PM Shehbaz Sharif publicly justified the move as standing "completely" with Bangladesh. This exposed how both governments made cricket a theatre of a political engagement against India.

Beyond Suryakumar Yadav. List of Indian-origin captains in T20 World Cup T20 World Cup 2026: It is not just the Indian team that will have a captain from India in the T20 World Cup. The mega event on Indian and Sri Lankan soil is set to witness several Indian-origin players leading their respective associate teams.

Tilak Varma gets angry at Arshdeep Singh: Don't take videos without permission T20 World Cup: India batter Tilak Varma got angry at Arshdeep Singh at the end of the team's warm-up game against South Africa. In the dressing room, Tilak told Arshdeep to not film him without permission.

Has Samson lost opener's battle to Kishan? Aakash Chopra gives his verdict T20 World Cup: Aakash Chopra said that Ishan Kishan cemented his place for the opener's slot with his 53-run knock against South Africa in the warm-up match on Wednesday in Navi Mumbai.

I quite like it: Hussain backs Bangladesh, Pakistan over World Cup boycott Nasser Hussain has lambasted the ICC and the BCCI over the ongoing uncertainty in the cricketing world. Nasser says that he quite likes the fact that the board stood up for their players.

Delhi look to break final curse, aim for 2024 revenge in battle of best friendsWPL 2026 Final, RCB vs DC Preview: In the battle of best friends, Jemimah Rodrigues' Delhi Capitals will be up against Smriti Mandhana's Royal Challengers Bengaluru in the summit clash on Thursday in Vadodara.

Time to stand up to BCCI, 400 million now on one side: Ex-Pak cricket chiefT20 World Cup 2026: Speaking to India Today, former Pakistan Cricket Board chief Najam Sethi said Pakistan is now standing up to BCCI by announcing the boycott of their game against India. Sethi said the ICC is run by people in the BCCI and Pakistan are willing to let go off short-term financial gains to end the bullying of the global cricket body.

Sanju Samson's fate sealed? Job's not finished with T20 World Cup 2026 in sightWith India's T20 plans taking shape, Sanju Samson faces a reduced role ahead of the 2026 World Cup. Staying ready, and being used wisely, may decide his future.

Rs 9 crore for ISL, Rs 100 crore for Kerala: How low has Indian football sunkThe ISL has its broadcast deal, but the numbers tell a harsher story. Now, valued below regional leagues and nowhere near cricket, Indian football's top tier has fallen from grace.
T20 World Cup: Pakistan PM confirms no change in India boycott stancePakistan Prime Minister Shahbaz Sharif confirmed that Pakistan will not play against India in the T20 World Cup 2026 group stage.

Could Goa break unsettle RCB? Smriti Mandhana opens up ahead of WPL finalWPL 2026: Smriti Mandhana said that Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) are fresh for the final against Delhi Capitals (DC) after they spent their one-week break enjoying in Goa.

IND vs SA, warm-up: Ishan edges Samson, Tilak back as India ready to defend crownIND vs SA, T20 World Cup Warm-ups: India's only warm-up turned into a statement as Ishan Kishan sealed the opener role, Tilak Varma returned in style, and the bowlers controlled the chase to down South Africa by 30 runs.

India among six bidders to host football's Asian Cup 2031India is among six nations bidding to host the AFC Asian Cup 2031, the Asian Football Confederation confirmed, as the country renews its push to stage the continent's top football tournament with full government backing.

PCB face heavy financial losses if they refuse to play India at T20 World Cup: ReportThe Pakistan Cricket Board risks significant financial losses if penalised by the ICC for not playing India in the T20 World Cup. This could lead to serious financial challenges amid ongoing stadium upgrades and revenue dependencies.

IND-PAK match can happen if Bangladesh are reinstated at T20 World Cup: Ex-PCB chiefFormer chief of the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB), Najam Sethi believes that there is still a chance that the India-Pakistan game can take place if Bangladesh are reinstated with their games being held in Sri Lanka.

Aaron George's 115 helps India chase a record 311 vs Afghanistan to reach finalICC U19 World Cup: India scripted a remarkable chase as opener Aaron George's heroic century powered them past a record 311 against Afghanistan in the second semi-final, setting up a title clash with England.

Ishan Kishan's blitz as opener vs South Africa puts Samson under serious pressureIND vs SA, T20 World Cup: Ishan Kishan went berserk in the warm-up match against South Africa at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai, scoring 53 off 20 balls with seven sixes before retiring out.

Fitness is getting better and I will be back soon: Rishabh PantIndia's wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant on Tuesday said he is recovering well from his injury and is hopeful of returning to competitive cricket at the earliest.

From JJ Smuts to Wayne Madsen: Italy's T20 World Cup stars you can't missT20 World Cup 2026: Italy are set to make their maiden appearance on the global stage. Led by Wayne Madsen, the Azzurri face a stern challenge in a tough group that also features England and the West Indies.

Mirabai Chanu shatters three national records at Weightlifting ChampionshipsIndian weightlifting star Mirabai Chanu continued her record-breaking run, rewriting the national marks with a commanding display at the National Weightlifting Championships on Wednesday.

U19 World Cup: Vaibhav steps up under pressure with 33-ball 68 in semi-finalIND-U19 vs AFG-U19: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi delivered a fearless counterattack under pressure, smashing 68 off just 33 balls to give India a flying start in their chase against Afghanistan in the Under-19 World Cup 2026 semi-final at the Harare Sports Club on Wednesday.

IND vs SA warmups Highlights: India beat South Africa by 30 runs in Navi MumbaiIND vs SA T20 World Cup Warm-Up Match: India beat South Africa by 30 runs at the Dr DY Patil Sports Academy in Navi Mumbai to win the warm-up match on Wednesday.

Rohit, Kohli for ODI World Cup? Dhoni tells Agarkar to focus on fitness, not ageFormer India captain MS Dhoni has given his verdict that Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli should be considered for the ODI World Cup in 2027. Dhoni's viewers have found a lot of takers among fans.

Sachin Tendulkar rallies Mumbai with timely pep talk before Ranji Trophy quarterfinalSachin Tendulkar shared insights on pressure and preparation with the Mumbai squad ahead of their Ranji Trophy quarterfinal against Karnataka, offering timely motivation before the knockout clash.

Inspired by Hardik Pandya, Bas de Leede aims for 'big man moments' in World CupNetherlands beat South Africa in the ODI World Cup hosted in India back in 2023. As they return for yet another world tournament, all-rounder Bas de Leede hopes to inspire them to consistency in big events.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
